I had a reservation at 830pm. I have been here for 35 minutes, I paid 130 dollars for the reservation and the blond lady just came to tell me she does not have a table for 13 and that I have to wait.

Fisrt time visit to this restaurant and I'm very impressed!!! I give a big thumbs up to every category. Food is very tasty, Service is very friendly (Even a trainee server). Love this place already and I'm sure I became reg.customer if I live near by.

Skip the Power Lunch.  I ordered a Turkey Brie w Sweet Potatoe Fries on their Power Lunch menu.  Unfortunately, the entire entree was a big disappoint. The bread was soggy and the fries, seasonless and soggy as well.  Additionally, the brie was just unevenly placed in the sandwich. There were caramelized onions but that did not help the flavor - the sandwich was just flavorless and, I have to repeat, soggy. Huge disappointment. (Also, I did not get all the items in the Power Lunch. The cookie was missing. The bag was double- tied when I arrived, and I did not check it.) I did enjoy the tomatoe basil bisque that came with the Power Lunch.  Everything else went into the trash, unfortunately.

Atmosphere is warm and comfortable. Waitstaff is attentive but mostly young and inexperienced. Food was... Ok. Ordered the mixed grill special. Gremolata ( overpowering and chemical flavor) on over-cooked scallops, undercooked fingerling potatoes and a passable steak with uninspired brown sauce poured over. Overall, quite "ok" but no better. Highlight was the dessert, a chocolate cake with ganache and mousse. Best part of the meal was feeling welcome to linger and chat, which we certainly did.

When I was about to leave Champaign for Chicago, my boss and I went on a culinary tour around Chambana and Silvercreek was on the top of our list. She was raving about the Sunday brunch and they were right, it was so so good.   There's an egg station if you want your eggs custom made. Then there's other fancy meats, fish like whole smoked salmon, pastries, and of course, desserts.  The price tag is expensive for the Chambana area but the food selection will all be worth it. This is a must do for anyone in town.
Good service, food and ambience. Convenient location as well. A little pricey on their beer and wine prices. Overall, worth a visit.

I ate here for my Graduation dinner. The service was pretty good and the food was decent. They have a pretty extensive menu and the atmosphere is great. The outside and surrrounding property at this place is awesome! I got some great pictures here with my family!

I tip my hat to Silvercreek and their amazing staff for accommodating my rather large family during my father's funeral. I know we were boisterous, but they didn't blink an eye and served us like royalty with quality food & beverages. We had called ahead initially to Longhorn Steakhouse (my mother's favorite) who informed us they wouldn't accept a party our size. A sibling and I had each had very good experiences with Silvercreek and were able to persuade my mother. This is now her favorite restaurant.

I wouldn't have been able to say it in the past, but Silvercreek is checking off all the boxes in my book. As usual, the atmosphere is comfortably casual. The wait staff professionally attentive without being intrusive, and whomever the chef is in the kitchen is cooking up some magic.  All these parts come together like a grand symphony skillfully orchestrated by the ever effervescent sprite of a woman, Grace.  To have Grace greet you at the door when you arrive at Silvercreek is like taking that first sip of Champagne where the bubbles tickles your nose and leaves you wanting for more.

Amazing place for the sunday brunch. The waffles and maple syrup are amongst the best you will get in town! Don't miss out on the enticing array of deserts, it is easy to, since there is such a wide variety of food before it!

1.  There was no wait for dinner (summer, around 6pm). 2.  Service was great.  We got water and bread pretty quickly, and they checked on us regularly, but not breathing down our necks. 3.  Food was ok.   - Truffle fries:  kind of just fries with some thick grated cheese on top, but not bad.  A large plate, so totally shareable between 3- 4 people. - Spinach Tagiatelle (vegetarian):  not seasoned enough.  There were enough tomatoes, mushrooms, and asparagus bits to make it colorful and interesting, but the dish itself was just ok.  I tasted, for the most part, pepper.    The other person who ordered a burger got fries that were very overdone.  Overall, it was just ok.  Perhaps not worth another trip.

We haven't been to Silvercreek in years - we were disappointed with the food. Rumor spread that they got a new manager.  We decided to give them another try.   The Chef's Line Burger is best burger in town - no exageration. Even my wife thinks so and she does not like to eat burgers. Tonight we enjoyed the appetizer buffet with oysters, chicken, shrimp, salads, artichoke dip, fresh fruit and chef cooked steak on the grill - delicious. You must try the Peach Kuchen to finish your meal.   Silvercreek is now our local favorite. If you haven't been lately you must give them a try.

Restaurant review Being 2.5 hours away from Chicago, I am still looking for a great modern America cuisine restaurant that is not simply a steak house. Silvercreek is likely the best that Champaign has to offer, but it still falls short of a 4 or 5 star dining experience in Chicago. As soon as you step into the restaurant, the all brick wall and wood ceiling interior adds a bit of class to your meal. We went in the summer time, but I can imagine how rustic it would feel in the winter with the large fireplaces that are along the adjacent wall. The server was quick to take our orders and get the kids meals out first with the appetizer. We went with the appetizer sampler which had the shrimp cocktail served with blue cheese mousse with cocktail sauce (FYI they serve it in such a weird shot glass that I thought it was an oyster in cocktail sauce....), calamari fried exceptionally well, marinated olives with a sweet zest, and duck prosciutto wrapped dates. It was nice trying a bunch of apps on plate. My duck entree is where it losses some stars as only 3/4 of this was cooked well, the other 1/4 was too well done on the chewy side. The cauliflower and parsnip puree along with the shiitake mushroom roasted cauliflower complemented the dish well especially the freshness of the vegetables. I am also very concern why there was a dark blue discoloration in the duck breast as noted in my picture. The redeeming quality is the extensive options on the menu and some farm to table elements.  Pros: refined menu that utilizes many components to the dish, special dinner menu, Sunday brunch  Cons: What is up with the blue discoloration in the duck breast and 1/4 of it was way over done  Hidden deals: 1. Sunday brunch buffet- I need to come back and give this a try 2. Pre-fixe menu- not advertised on the website 3 course meal for 29.99 3. Global Wednesday- unique foods from around the world 4. Live music Friday night

I had eaten here a little over a year ago and it was one of the worst places I had eaten in the Champaign/Urbana area. I had recently been back and all I can say is WOW! The food is absolutely amazing. I returned here every Friday for 3 weeks after my return visit. Amazing wine, food and service. They had live music when I was there which was fantastic. The bread basket was great as well. 5/5 on all marks, decor, service, beverage, food and price. I will definitely be returning many times in the future.

Amazing lunch for a decent price! I don't know why everybody is bitching so hardcore about this place. I almost didn't try this place because of all the one star reviews but my grandma loves the creme brûlée here so we went.  I had the lunch combo: half the gourmet grilled cheese (awesome), tomato basil soup (amazing), and sweet potato french fries (nothing to rave about but nothing bad with them).  For dessert we had the vanilla creme brûlée topped with fresh blueberries and strawberries. AMAZING!   We both had lunch, a dessert, and each an herbal tea (great selection of herbal teas!) and the total was only $34.50.  They also have a nice outdoor area to sit.
